other_tests.findings: The histologic examination revealed a superficial perivascular infiltrate, predominantly neutrophilic, associated with leukocytoclasis and no evidence of vasculitis. Mild vacuolar changes at the dermoepidermal junction were also noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient showed improvement after treatment but experienced a rash recurrence two weeks after discharge, with lesions on follow-up suggesting changes indicative of systemic lupus erythematosus.

other_tests.findings: Positive at a titer of 1:2560 with a homogeneous pattern.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Titer increased to 1:1280 during hospital admission.
